intro: Lotononis microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
